msContents.summary: Images 2l-3r: Image of Zär’a Buruk, not in Répertoire. Incipit : ስላም ለዝከረ ስምከ እግዚአብሔር ዘአስተብዖ. Images 6r-113l: Forty-Two Miracles of Abunä Zär‘a Buruk. "Now we start the book of the miracles of Saint Abuna Zar'a Buruk, one of the children of Gerlos (ጌርሎው) the Martyr. He was murdered with a spear because of his right faith. [It was started] in year 7,197 of the creaton of the world [= 1697], in the 281st year of mercy, in the year of Matthew, the Evangelist, Miyazya 1, at the ninth night, in the third hour of the day, in the 23rd year of King Iyasu [1682-1706]. Six years after he departed from this world which passes to the world that will not pass away, they started to write these miracles." Image 1r: pentrial on the trinitarian formula. Illuminations are added recently. Image 6r, top: note of ownership: This book belongs to አባ ወልደ ተክሌ. Primary owner was ወልደ ሚካኤል; the secondary owner is ወልደ ሥላሴ.
